info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 4:23PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Chesterfield County and the City of Richmond through 500 PM EDT... At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bon Air, moving east southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Bon Air, Chester, University Of Richmond, Bensley, Bellwood, Chesterfield Court House, Chesterfield, Richmond Heights, Midlothian, Pocahontas State Park, Drewrys Bluff, Centralia and Montrose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
